Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: only native nodes mining or staking could chose the true chain. Each oracle would need to be a full node at minimum, though done have to min/stake, but if no one does, no new blocks means no forks, so that solves that.

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
`The miners are incentivized to mine on the version of history where they can sell the tokens for a profit.`
So, if I pay you more then my data is more "valid" than competing data that pays you less?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that doesnt seem very practical

Author: zack#6467
Content:
what is more important is how much the users are paying for the different coins on each side of the fork.
The miners can only mine if they are paid enough rewards to cover the cost.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: doesnt imply trust either

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems a lot of users need to be actively voting with their node for the Toracles to converge to reality

Author: zack#6467
Content: the traders aren't running a full node, but their trades still have the biggest influence on the outcome of the fork

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: why would I agree with what is less profitable, regardless of truth?

Author: zack#6467
Content: in Amoveo a *oracle*is an on-chain datastructure. like an account or a channel.

Author: zack#6467
Content: each person is expected to make the most profitable decisions for themselves in Amoveo. we don't assume anyone is altruistic.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems easy to use mechanism for users to disagree with any specific oracle is needed, otherwise there is zero force pushing things toward the actual reality

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so users can select from N forks, each with a displayed value of the various oracles states?

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
`each person is expected to make the most profitable decisions for themselves in Amoveo. we don't assume anyone is altruistic.`
You do see the ability for that to create manipulated data, right?

Author: zack#6467
Content: Neither do we assume that they are not altruistic. It is a secure oracle mechanism.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is trusting that people will pay more for the more true chain

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: better to disincentivize  inaccurate data than to reward shared delusion

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: zack#6467
Content: A basic assumption of Amoveo is that the version of history that is more accurate will have more valuable coins.

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
` It is a secure oracle mechanism.`
Both cannot be true, either it's "secure" or it's "up to the highest bidder"

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: can you trust an assumption?

Author: zack#6467
Content: if that isn't true, then Amoveo might not work.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: does amoveo have forks all the time?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like all the time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems it would need to have competing forks pretty much all the time for there to be a chain with the more valuable coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: otherwise there is just one mainchain

Author: zack#6467
Content:
Every engineering solution makes some basic assumptions.
Bridge designers have assumptions about the maximum possible load, and the years until the bridge will be replaced.
Bitcoin's basic assumption is that it is always most profitable to mine on the top block.

Author: MyName#0491
Content: If I say "grass is blue" and history says "grass is green", then what you describe dictates that I can pay miners to agree that "grass is blue"

Author: zack#6467
Content: Amoveo hasn't forked yet

Author: zack#6467
Content: There is a balance of powers between traders, exchanges, miners, mining pools, and developers

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: what does `bad question` mean?

Author: zack#6467
Content: the oracle mechanism has an on-chain tool for moving your money back and forth between each side of the fork

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but you said there hasnt been any forks

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Have you heard the good word of *cryptoconditions*?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so there is nothing to choose between

Author: zack#6467
Content:
right, the nash equilibrium is for one side of the fork to quickly go to zero value and die.
In most cases, it is a fork of 0 blocks long.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how do the miners know the right state for all the oracles?

Author: MyName#0491
Content: _really wants to be in "jam/fold" mode every time you type that_

Author: zack#6467
Content:
Before the oracle resolves, you can use it to make a bet. 
If the blockchain does fork, then you would win the bet on one side, and lose on the other.
This allows us to move the money between the forks.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you have had such forks?

Author: zack#6467
Content: we have had contentious oracles, but none resulted in a fork

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: so its the miners that lose out for being"wrong"? are all miners oracles?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how can the miners know the right state for the oracle?

Author: zack#6467
Content: the miners just process txs, they don't have to think about oracles generally.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: but what if they end up on wrong chain?

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
`In most cases, it is a fork of 0 blocks long.`
Meaning a race situation with an orphan?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: passive investor is never on wrong chain?

Author: zack#6467
Content: if an oracle is about to lie, I would release a hard update and tell the miners about it, and they would verify the lie is coming and do the update to make sure that their mining pool will not follow the lying version

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: so why mine instaed of buy?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a hard update? you mean hardfork?

Content: how do you know a oracle is about to "lie"?

Author: zack#6467
Content: it would just prevent the mining pool from accepting any block that closes the oracle in a state we have agreed is lying.

Content: The people who bet in an oracle would notice that it is going to lie, and alert me
